intro: Pentopetia androsaemifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its low water requirements, it is considered a drought-tolerant species suitable for xeriscaping.
